content:
• Tuesday, January 24, 2012
  • ASRT

    Specialty pharmaceutical company Depomed (DEPO) says it's initiated Phase 2 clinical trials of...

    Specialty pharmaceutical company Depomed (DEPO) says it's initiated Phase 2 clinical trials of DM-1992 in patients with advanced Parkinson's disease. Shares +3.8% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:58 PM
  • WPZ

    Natural gas firm Williams Partners (NYSE:WPZ) falls 3.4% AH after announcing it will issue 6.5M...

    Natural gas firm Williams Partners (NYSE:WPZ) falls 3.4% AH after announcing it will issue 6.5M shares, good for proceeds of $421.5M as of today's close. Williams plans to use the proceeds to finance capital expenditures, and to help pay for its acquisition of Laser Northeast Gathering System.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:46 PM
  • NVDA

    Nvidia (NASDAQ:NVDA) drops 3.3% AH after warning it expects FQ4 (ends Jan. 29) revenue of $950M,...

    Nvidia (NASDAQ:NVDA) drops 3.3% AH after warning it expects FQ4 (ends Jan. 29) revenue of $950M, plus or minus 1%, below a Street consensus of $1.06B. Nvidia blames the hard drive shortages and price hikes caused by Thai flooding, and a decline in sales for the Tegra 2 (used in many high-end Android tablets). Archrival AMD just reported weak sales for its PC graphics chip business.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:37 PM
  • RDN

    Radian Group (NYSE:RDN) +2% AH after Assured Guaranty (NYSE:AGO) agrees to re-assume a $12.9B...

    Radian Group (NYSE:RDN) +2% AH after Assured Guaranty (NYSE:AGO) agrees to re-assume a $12.9B portfolio of ceded risk tied to public finance and structured finance credits. AGO also will acquire Municipal and Infrastructure Assurance Corp. from RDN. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 6:11 PM
  • MRCY

    More on Mercury Computer Systems (NASDAQ:MRCY): FQ2 EPS beats estimates with revenues coming in...

    More on Mercury Computer Systems (NASDAQ:MRCY): FQ2 EPS beats estimates with revenues coming in line. Defense sales, including ACS and Mercury Federal Systems, increased 46% Y/Y, while Defense bookings rose 27% over the same period. The company warns for Q3 however, now expecting to earn between $0.09 - $0.11 per share, below Street EPS estimates of $0.18. Shares -4% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:10 PM
  • AMD

    More on AMD's Q4: The chipmaker expects revenue to decline 5%-11% Q/Q in seasonally weak Q1....

    More on AMD's Q4: The chipmaker expects revenue to decline 5%-11% Q/Q in seasonally weak Q1. Computing Solutions revenue rose 7% Y/Y, up from 5% in Q3, thanks to strong chipset and notebook CPU sales. CPU selling prices were flat Y/Y. Graphics processor sales fell 10% Y/Y, worse than Q3's 4% drop, as CPUs with integrated graphics continue taking share. AMD -2.6% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:10 PM | 1 Comment
  • QRVO

    Apple's blowout earnings push a bevy of supply chain shares higher AH: TQNT +7.9%, NUAN +6.8%,...

    Apple's blowout earnings push a bevy of supply chain shares higher AH: TQNT +7.9%, NUAN +6.8%, CRUS +6.1%, ZAGG +5.5%, BRCM +3.7%, SNDK +2.9%, SWKS +2.9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:05 PM
  • AAPL

    More on Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL): FQ1 gross margin was 44.7%, up 780 bps Q/Q and 620 bps Y/Y. Not...

    More on Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL): FQ1 gross margin was 44.7%, up 780 bps Q/Q and 620 bps Y/Y. Not counting Apple stores, Americas revenue +92% Y/Y, Europe +55%, Japan +148%, Asia-Pac +54% (delayed China iPhone launch). Retail revenue +58%, up from just 1% in FQ4. Ended quarter with $97.7B in cash and investments. AAPL has resumed trading, up 8.8%. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:52 PM | 9 Comments
  • NSC

    More on Norfolk Southern (NYSE:NSC): Q4 beat on a per share basis, but the shares are trading...

    More on Norfolk Southern (NYSE:NSC): Q4 beat on a per share basis, but the shares are trading lower in the post session after missing on revenue. In spite of the earnings miss, profit jumped 19% Y/Y, driven by an 11% improvement in revenue per unit, a 24% jump in coal hauling revenue and an 18% rise in intermodal revenue. Shares -2.8% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:51 PM
  • MRCY

    Mercury Computer Systems (NASDAQ:MRCY): FQ2 EPS of $0.30 beats by $0.05. Revenue of $68M (+20%...

    Mercury Computer Systems (NASDAQ:MRCY): FQ2 EPS of $0.30 beats by $0.05. Revenue of $68M (+20% Y/Y) in-line. Shares -3.9% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:46 PM
  • AAPL

    More on Apple's (NASDAQ:AAPL) FQ1: 37.04M iPhones shipped vs. 30.2M consensus and 34M whisper...

    More on Apple's (NASDAQ:AAPL) FQ1: 37.04M iPhones shipped vs. 30.2M consensus and 34M whisper number. 15.4M iPads vs. 13.2M consensus. 5.2M Macs vs. 5M consensus. 15.4M iPods vs. 15.5M consensus. Company guides for FQ2 revenue of $32.5B ($32B consensus) and EPS of $8.50 ($8.03 consensus), Apple to resume trading at 4:50 P.M. ET. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:42 PM | 9 Comments
  • ANGO

    Shares of AngioDynamics (ANGO +2.4%) were roiled late in the trading day after the company cut...

    Shares of AngioDynamics (ANGO +2.4%) were roiled late in the trading day after the company cut its FQ3 and FY revenue forecast and halted shipments of it NanoKnife ablation device in the U.S. due to a software recall. It now sees Q3 sales between $50M - $53M versus estimates of $53M, and 2012 sales of around $215M - $219M compared to expectations of $221M.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:38 PM
  • AAPL

    Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL) shares have been halted in advance of the company's FQ1 release.

    Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL) shares have been halted in advance of the company's FQ1 release.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:30 PM
  • FIO

    More on Fusion-io's FQ2: Gross margin for quarter was 51%, down 770 bps Y/Y. Expects FQ3 revenue...

    More on Fusion-io's FQ2: Gross margin for quarter was 51%, down 770 bps Y/Y. Expects FQ3 revenue of $85M and gross margin of 50%, expects FY12 revenue growth of 65%-70% (prior guidance of 55%) and gross margin of 54%-56% (prior guidance of 56%). Expects FY12 operating margin of 8% (prior guidance of 6%-8%). FIO -11.2% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:29 PM
  • CA

    More on CA's (NASDAQ:CA) FQ3 report: Bookings up 2% Y/Y to $1.284B. Total revenue backlog grew...

    More on CA's (NASDAQ:CA) FQ3 report: Bookings up 2% Y/Y to $1.284B. Total revenue backlog grew 2% Y/Y to $8.084B. Targets return of $2.5B to shareholders through capital allocation program by 2014 including increase in annual dividend to $1.00/share from $0.20/share and authorization to repurchase up to $1.5B in stock. Shares +15.1% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:24 PM
  • GMCR

    A day after selling off on a negative Bernstein note, Green Mountain Coffee (GMCR +4.4%) has...

    A day after selling off on a negative Bernstein note, Green Mountain Coffee (GMCR +4.4%) has rallied today, perhaps with the help of positive SymphonyIRI data. The research firm estimates U.S. retail coffee sales rose 19% Y/Y in the 52 weeks ending Dec. 25, and that sales of "single packets" of ground coffee such as Green Mountain's K-Cups nearly doubled.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:00 PM
  • OSIS

    OSI Systems (OSIS +5.7%) FQ2 beats estimates across the board as earnings jumped 33% Y/Y, buoyed...

    OSI Systems (OSIS +5.7%) FQ2 beats estimates across the board as earnings jumped 33% Y/Y, buoyed by solid revenue growth particularly at its security business. The company also raises its FY guidance, now expecting to earn $2.30 - $2.42 on revenue of $750M - $770M.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:31 PM
  • PBR

    Petrobas (PBR +3.6%) dismisses the earlier chatter about the oil major making a play for...

    Petrobas (PBR +3.6%) dismisses the earlier chatter about the oil major making a play for Transocean (RIG +1.6%). Shares of RIG have settled back after being 5.6% higher after the buzz picked up.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:12 PM | 3 Comments
  • CSFSF

    The Cash Store Financial Stores (CSFS -9.6%) tanks after its preliminary FQ1 guidance met with...

    The Cash Store Financial Stores (CSFS -9.6%) tanks after its preliminary FQ1 guidance met with disfavor from investors. Adding to the negative pressure was the disclosure by the company that a significant amount of short interest is being built up in the stock.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:59 PM
  • KLAC

    Citigroup's Terence Whalen picks up coverage of semi equipment stocks and raises KLA Tencor...

    Citigroup's Terence Whalen picks up coverage of semi equipment stocks and raises KLA Tencor (KLAC +1.2%) and Novellus (NVLS-OLD +3.1%) to Buy from Neutral, while cutting FormFactor (FORM -2.6%) to Neutral. Investors “have yet to correctly quantify escalating capital intensity” in the chip manufacturing business, he asserts, expecting wafer fab equipment spending will near $36B in three years.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:54 PM
  • KUTV

    Shares of Chinese online video site Ku6 Media (KUTV +9.1%) spike higher on reports that...

    Shares of Chinese online video site Ku6 Media (KUTV +9.1%) spike higher on reports that Alibaba's Jack Ma is considering taking a stake in the firm. Last week, the company landed a content-sharing partnership with YouTube that will allow international users to view videos from China.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:47 PM
  • PCYC

    Pharmacylics (PCYC +5.5%) climbs higher after Johnson & Johnson's Q4 report provides a positive...

    Pharmacylics (PCYC +5.5%) climbs higher after Johnson & Johnson's Q4 report provides a positive look at the status of a development deal between the two firms.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:36 PM
  • GOLD

    Barrick Gold (ABX -2.5%) trades down after RBC cut the shares to Sector Perform earlier this...

    Barrick Gold (ABX -2.5%) trades down after RBC cut the shares to Sector Perform earlier this morning, saying the miner is exposed to the risk of delays and cost escalations at three major new mines under construction in the Dominican Republic, Chile and Saudi Arabia.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:18 PM
  • TCF

    TCF Financial (TCB -9.6%) gets hammered after its Q4 revenue and earnings both missed analysts'...

    TCF Financial (TCB -9.6%) gets hammered after its Q4 revenue and earnings both missed analysts' consensus view as credit quality remains a challenge for the regional bank.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:05 PM
  • IDCC

    Dougherty responds to the failure of InterDigital's (IDCC -18.5%) "strategic review" to produce...

    Dougherty responds to the failure of InterDigital's (IDCC -18.5%) "strategic review" to produce a sale by downgrading shares to Neutral. With no suitor on the way, InterDigital now has to contend with an unresolved patent dispute with Nokia, and market share losses (I, II) for licensees Research In Motion and HTC. However, Barclays sees InterDigital's Q4 results as a reason for hope.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:04 PM

  • EpiCept (EPCT -13.9%) trades lower after the microcap pharmaceutical confirms that it engaged...

    EpiCept (EPCT -13.9%) trades lower after the microcap pharmaceutical confirms that it engaged SunTrust Robinson Humphrey to explore strategic options including an evaluation of a potential sale.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:59 PM
  • LGF.A

    Shares of Lions Gate (LGF +2.2%) perk up midday on heavy volume after Stifel Nicolaus' Ben Mogil...

    Shares of Lions Gate (LGF +2.2%) perk up midday on heavy volume after Stifel Nicolaus' Ben Mogil slots in the company as a Buy, up from his previous rating of Hold.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:52 PM
  • A

    Agilent Technologies (A +3.5%) moves up after UBS raises its price target to $47 from $43,...

    Agilent Technologies (A +3.5%) moves up after UBS raises its price target to $47 from $43, noting the company's recent shareholder-friendly dividend initiation justifies a higher valuation.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:47 PM
  • APD

    Air Products (APD -3.2%) dips after its FQ1 revenues fell short of the mark. Profits dropped...

    Air Products (APD -3.2%) dips after its FQ1 revenues fell short of the mark. Profits dropped 7.6% Y/Y on continued weakness in its equipment and energy segments and slower growth in merchant and tonnage gas sales. The company also says FQ2 earnings will be below estimates due to a slowing economy, but Asia and North American growth should accelerate in H2.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:39 PM
  • AABA

    Though Macquarie analyst Ben Schachter sees Yahoo (YHOO +0.4%) as a $20 stock if it gets a deal...

    Though Macquarie analyst Ben Schachter sees Yahoo (YHOO +0.4%) as a $20 stock if it gets a deal done to sell its Asian assets, he says (video) the issue probably won't be discussed much in today's Q4 report and CC with new CEO Scott Thompson still getting his feet wet.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:13 PM
  • GOL

    Brazilian airline Gol Linhas (GOL -1.2%) says domestic demand in December climbed 2.8% Y/Y and...

    Brazilian airline Gol Linhas (GOL -1.2%) says domestic demand in December climbed 2.8% Y/Y and rebounded 8.5% from November, with the number of seats offered climbing by 8.3% on the year. However, its load factor, the percentage of seats occupied on flights, fell 3.5% Y/Y to 65.5%.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:56 PM
  • DNDN

    Dendreon (DNDN +6.4%) catches a bid on more rumors (previous) that the firm is in the sights of...

    Dendreon (DNDN +6.4%) catches a bid on more rumors (previous) that the firm is in the sights of Amgen (AMGN +0.4%) as an acquisition.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:52 PM
  • PLCM

    Polycom (PLCM +18.3%) surges after reporting a 50% leap in Q4 net income, surpassing...

    Polycom (PLCM +18.3%) surges after reporting a 50% leap in Q4 net income, surpassing estimates. Stifel Nicolaus upgrades shares to Buy and raises its price target to $29 from $25; while too early to signal a definitive comeback, it sees European and Asian sales/execution, momentum with partners, and sales of its RealPresence infrastructure product moving in the right direction. (submitted by Holly Thompson)

     
     
     
     
    | 12:51 PM
  • VMW

    Strong Q4 reports (I, II, III) from VMware (VMW +7.3%), EMC (EMC +5.7%), and Polycom (PLCM...

    Strong Q4 reports (I, II, III) from VMware (VMW +7.3%), EMC (EMC +5.7%), and Polycom (PLCM +18.2%) are providing a lift to some high-beta enterprise IT and telecom names. FFIV +1.8%. RVBD +1.7%. APKT +3.1%. FIO +3.1%. OCZ +6.4%. STEC +3.2%. (VMW transcript) (PLCM transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 12:47 PM
  • KSU

    Kansas City Southern (KSU -7.1%) trades lower this morning after its Q4 beat EPS estimates but...

    Kansas City Southern (KSU -7.1%) trades lower this morning after its Q4 beat EPS estimates but came up far short on revenue. Margins grew as carload volume increased on growth in coal, intermodal and automotive shipping, but were offset by declines in its chemical and petroleum, industrial and consumer, and agricultural and minerals units.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:46 PM
  • ALB

    Albemarle (ALB +4.1%) shares jump after reporting record Q4 and full-year results, beating...

    Albemarle (ALB +4.1%) shares jump after reporting record Q4 and full-year results, beating analysts' estimates, as each of the specialty chemicals maker's business segments recorded the highest revenue and profitability in the company's history.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:42 PM
  • JAH

    Jarden (JAH +8.2%) shares surge after projecting Q4 revenue slightly ahead of consensus and...

    Jarden (JAH +8.2%) shares surge after projecting Q4 revenue slightly ahead of consensus and saying it plans to accelerate up to $500M in stock buybacks. The maker of slow cookers and coffee brewers increases guidance for Q4 revenue to $1.73B-$1.74B, up from a previous estimate of $1.72B.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:38 PM | 1 Comment
  • BVSN

    BroadVision (BVSN +17%) continues its epic 2012 romp, now up 257% YTD on no news of note. The...

    BroadVision (BVSN +17%) continues its epic 2012 romp, now up 257% YTD on no news of note. The move likely shows what stock promoters working with a tiny float can occasionally accomplish. Tim Collins notes no options trade on the stock, making engineering a short squeeze a lot easier. Coming soon: the crash and the SEC investigation?

     
     
     
     
    | 12:27 PM | 3 Comments
  • MNK

    Questcor Pharmaceuticals (QCOR +2.1%) trades higher after TheStreetSweeper issues the first part...

    Questcor Pharmaceuticals (QCOR +2.1%) trades higher after TheStreetSweeper issues the first part of a much-anticipated 2-part report. In the report, which Questcor has already gone to great lengths to denounce, TheStreetSweeper accuses Questcor of marketing its Acthar drug for unsanctioned uses, and of failing to establish a "firewall" between its marketing and R&D departments.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:24 PM | 1 Comment
  • AEZS

    Drug developer Aeterna Zentaris (AEZS -4.9%) moves lower after announcing an "at-the-market"...

    Drug developer Aeterna Zentaris (AEZS -4.9%) moves lower after announcing an "at-the-market" stock issuance program through which it can sell up to 10.4M shares.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:11 PM
  • BTU

    Peabody Energy (BTU -4.8%) takes a hit after its Q4 missed estimates across the board, largely...

    Peabody Energy (BTU -4.8%) takes a hit after its Q4 missed estimates across the board, largely due to costs from its $5B acquisition of Macarthur Coal. Additionally, the miner says it expects lower coal output and earnings in 2012 as it plans to spend much of the year bringing the newly acquired Australian coal mines up to industry standards.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:08 PM
  • ATML

    Atmel (ATML -2.2%) is downgraded to Hold from Buy at Needham after surging 24% YTD, citing...

    Atmel (ATML -2.2%) is downgraded to Hold from Buy at Needham after surging 24% YTD, citing risks of an inventory correction for non-Apple tablets inventory correction (ATML has 70%-80% share) and effects on gross margins. With 2012 Street EPS estimates potentially falling below $0.80, the firm believes the risk/reward profile is "balanced" at current share levels.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:56 AM
  • CRK

    Comstock (CRK -2.4%) dips on a Global Hunter downgrade to Neutral, citing capex and growth...

    Comstock (CRK -2.4%) dips on a Global Hunter downgrade to Neutral, citing capex and growth concerns due to cheap gas and limited liquidity. The firm says Comstock is entering the new year with its gas position, which comprises a significant chunk of its revenue, completely unhedged.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:50 AM
  • MRVL

    Cavium (CAVM -2.4%) trades lower after Piper reiterates an Underweight and $16 PT (50% below its...

    Cavium (CAVM -2.4%) trades lower after Piper reiterates an Underweight and $16 PT (50% below its current price). Though expecting Cavium, which issued a Q4 warning last month, to report in-line results on Feb. 2, the firm thinks the network processor vendor "lacks earnings power."

     
     
     
     
    | 11:37 AM
  • NOK

    Goldman's Tim Boddy thinks Nokia (NOK -7%) could cut its fat dividend to conserve cash as "a...

    Goldman's Tim Boddy thinks Nokia (NOK -7%) could cut its fat dividend to conserve cash as "a hedge against a more painful transition to Microsoft products than expected." Recent strength in shares based on long-term hopes for Windows Phone software will reverse, he says, as H1 guidance and Lumia’s slow ramp “reminds investors that Nokia remains in a challenging transition period." (also)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:28 AM
  • A

    Agilent (A +4%) gets a lift from a bullish UBS report. The firm believes Agilent's recent...

    Agilent (A +4%) gets a lift from a bullish UBS report. The firm believes Agilent's recent introduction of a quarterly dividend ($0.10/share) justifies the test equipment maker receiving a higher valuation, as it demonstrates management's understanding that it "must wisely allocate capital" in the absence of compelling M&A opportunities.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:26 AM
  • JNP

    Canaccord Genuity weighs in on Columbia Laboratories (CBRX +2.2%) after the firm was rocked by a...

    Canaccord Genuity weighs in on Columbia Laboratories (CBRX +2.2%) after the firm was rocked by a FDA rejection of its preterm birth prevention gel. Though analyst Randall Stanicky acknowledges the "disappointment," he still sees potential for CBRX and rival Watson Pharmaceuticals (WPI -3.4%) on possible M&A activity and the under-leveraged balance sheets the firms carry.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:24 AM
  • RBCN

    Rubicon Tech (RBCN -8.6%) is downgraded to Hold from Buy at Kaufman with a reduced target price...

    Rubicon Tech (RBCN -8.6%) is downgraded to Hold from Buy at Kaufman with a reduced target price of $13 from $16, after shares have climbed 33% in three weeks. The firm had expected the downturn in sapphire wafer pricing and volumes to be relatively short lived, but given the slower-than-expected pickup in end-market demand, it now believes the downturn may be prolonged.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:16 AM

  • Wheat flies higher, jumping $0.18 in minutes to $6.33/bushel on worries about export curbs from...

    Wheat flies higher, jumping $0.18 in minutes to $6.33/bushel on worries about export curbs from Russia. Agrimoney reports it's not just official quotas, but logistical issues are slowing exports as well - shortages of railcars are making it difficult to move product to port.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:06 AM
  • NTR

    Potash (POT -2.8%) dips after JP Morgan cuts the shares to Neutral, citing high global potash...

    Potash (POT -2.8%) dips after JP Morgan cuts the shares to Neutral, citing high global potash inventories, slowing markets in North America and Europe and the inability to sustain price increases in Asia.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:57 AM | 1 Comment
  • JJSF

    J&J Snack Foods (JJSF -8%) takes a hit after its FQ1 largely disappointed on a net basis, as...

    J&J Snack Foods (JJSF -8%) takes a hit after its FQ1 largely disappointed on a net basis, as the cost of goods sold for the quarter jumped over 15% Y/Y. Gerald Shreiber, J & J's President and CEO, commented, "Although our overall sales grew modestly, higher input costs and operating expenses impacted our profitability for the period and the six months."

     
     
     
     
    | 10:40 AM
  • ACHN

    Following a common theme of Hepatitis C-related stocks running together, Achillion...

    Following a common theme of Hepatitis C-related stocks running together, Achillion Pharmaceuticals (ACHN +12.1%) rallies strongly after Israel-based BioLineRX announces a major development deal. Other Hep-C players to watch: INHX, IDIX, VRTX.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:36 AM
  • S

    Clearwire (CLWR +2.6%) rallies after preannouncing Q4 results. Revenue of $362M beats Street...

    Clearwire (CLWR +2.6%) rallies after preannouncing Q4 results. Revenue of $362M beats Street estimates by $5.7M, and net wholesale subscriber adds totaled 900K - that figure is down sharply from Q3's 1.9M wholesale adds, and reflects the impact of Sprint's (NYSE:S) iPhone sales. In addition, though it ended Q4 with $1.11B in cash and equivalents, Clearwire is announcing a new $300M debt offering.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:33 AM
  • ADSK

    Jefferies raises its estimates and price target for Autodesk (ADSK +1.9%) after the firm's...

    Jefferies raises its estimates and price target for Autodesk (ADSK +1.9%) after the firm's reseller survey indicates better-than-normal seasonal trends for the channel in FQ4. Overall demand conditions seem to be improving again, the firm says, and even the data from Europe was "OK." The price target is raised to $43 from $40. (submitted by Holly Thompson)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:20 AM
  • WAT

    Waters (WAT +8.1%) rallies off of a Q4 earnings beat, as it reports EPS of $1.56/share vs....

    Waters (WAT +8.1%) rallies off of a Q4 earnings beat, as it reports EPS of $1.56/share vs. $1.50/share consensus. The company clocked roughly in-line revenue of $521M for the period, with its sales growth offset by foreign currency swings.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:17 AM
  • PRGS

    Activist hedge fund Starboard Value says it took a 5.1% stake in Progress Software (PRGS +1.5%)...

    Activist hedge fund Starboard Value says it took a 5.1% stake in Progress Software (PRGS +1.5%) and delivers a letter to CEO Jay Bhatt and the board stating that the company is deeply undervalued with a current market price that fails to reflect the value of a sum of its parts. Starboard says it wants to talk with Bhatt and the board to "explore ways to unlock value."

     
     
     
     
    | 10:11 AM
  • EAT

    Shares of Brinker International (EAT -7.2%) retreat after the restaurant operator shows FQ2...

    Shares of Brinker International (EAT -7.2%) retreat after the restaurant operator shows FQ2 revenue that came in below the consensus estimate of analysts. The firm's Chili's chain showed tepid comparable-store sales growth of 1.4% for the quarter, while Maggiano's registered a 2.8% increase.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:08 AM
  • WDC

    Western Digital's (WDC +7.7%) FQ2 revenue beat and upward guidance wins at least one convert,...

    Western Digital's (WDC +7.7%) FQ2 revenue beat and upward guidance wins at least one convert, Needham’s Richard Kugele, who raises his rating to Buy from Hold, writing that his concerns stemming from the cost of the flooding in Thailand have been alleviated. WDC’s confidence that it will conclude its acquisition of Hitachi's storage division relieves him of worries the deal will drag on.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:59 AM
  • TZOO

    Shares of Travelzoo (NASDAQ:TZOO) come out of the gate strong, up 2.9%. An article on SA...

    Shares of Travelzoo (NASDAQ:TZOO) come out of the gate strong, up 2.9%. An article on SA suggests a TZOO-AOL merger would make tactical sense - pointing out that a marriage of the two firms has the potential to tap into the huge upside to the legalization of online gambling in the U.S.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:56 AM
  • BB

    Shares of Research in Motion (RIMM -4.3%) lose more ground as analysts continue to cast a...

    Shares of Research in Motion (RIMM -4.3%) lose more ground as analysts continue to cast a skeptical eye on the company’s naming of a new CEO yesterday. Jefferies is the latest to weigh in, concluding RIM will continue to be at a “cost disadvantage” to other smartphone makers until there’s a restructuring and it realizes it "will not be able to compete head-on with Apple and Android."
     
     
     
     
    | 9:51 AM
  • PSS

    More takeover talk sparks Collective Brands (PSS +3.2%) shares, as Bloomberg speculates the...

    More takeover talk sparks Collective Brands (PSS +3.2%) shares, as Bloomberg speculates the company "may extract the biggest takeover premium of any apparel retailer in the world."
